extension.searchTitle: ANNOUNCEMENT BY THE SPEAKER PRO TEMPORE; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 81
KELSEY SMITH ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 81

congVote.result: So (two-thirds not being in the affirmative) the motion was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House failed to agree to suspend the rules and pass the following measure:<P/>H.R. 4889, amended, to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to require providers of a covered service to provide call location information concerning the telecommunications device of a user of such service to an investigative or law enforcement officer in an emergency situation involving risk of death or serious physical injury or in order to respond to the user's call for emergency services, by a 2/3 yea-and-nay vote of 229 yeas to 158 nays, Roll No. 229.

titleInfo.title: SECURING ACCESS TO NETWORKS IN DISASTERS ACT

extension.searchTitle: SECURING ACCESS TO NETWORKS IN DISASTERS ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 81

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Securing Access to Networks in Disasters Act
Securing Access to Networks in Disasters Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures: D560<P/>H.R. 3998, amended, to direct the Federal Communications Commission to commence proceedings related to the resiliency of critical telecommunications networks during times of emergency, by a 2/3 yea-and-nay vote of 389 yeas to 2 nays, Roll No. 230;

The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures: D560<P/>H.R. 3998, amended, to direct the Federal Communications Commission to commence proceedings related to the resiliency of critical telecommunications networks during times of emergency, by a 2/3 yea-and-nay vote of 389 yeas to 2 nays, Roll No. 230;<P/>Agreed to amend the title so as to read: ``To direct the Federal Communications Commission to conduct a study on network resiliency during times of emergency, and for other purposes.''.

congVote.result: This bill (S. 2613), as amended, was passed, as follows:
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: By a unanimous vote of 89 yeas (Vote No. 83), Senate passed S. 2613, to reauthorize certain programs established by the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006, after agreeing to the committee amendment in the nature of a substitute, and taking action on the following amendment proposed thereto:

By a unanimous vote of 89 yeas (Vote No. 83), Senate passed S. 2613, to reauthorize certain programs established by the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006, after agreeing to the committee amendment in the nature of a substitute, and taking action on the following amendment proposed thereto:<P/>McConnell (for Grassley) Amendment No. 4078, relating to the definition of sexual assault.
